class.name: ErrorManager
class.comment: We declare standard error codes for important categories of errors.
class.javadoc:
ErrorManager objects can be attached to Handlers to process any error that occurs on a Handler during Logging.

When processing logging output, if a Handler encounters problems then rather than throwing an Exception back to the issuer of the logging call (who is unlikely to be interested) the Handler should call its associated ErrorManager.
GENERIC_FAILURE is used for failure that don't fit into one of the other categories.
WRITE_FAILURE is used when a write to an output stream fails.
FLUSH_FAILURE is used when a flush to an output stream fails.
CLOSE_FAILURE is used when a close of an output stream fails.
OPEN_FAILURE is used when an open of an output stream fails.
FORMAT_FAILURE is used when formatting fails for any reason.

The error method is called when a Handler failure occurs.

This method may be overridden in subclasses. The default behavior in this base class is that the first call is reported to System.err, and subsequent calls are ignored. msg a descriptive string (may be null) ex an exception (may be null) code an error code defined in ErrorManager

method.name: error
method.comment: We only report the first error, to avoid clogging
